newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish troops kill 27 Kurd rebels in southeast.
newsitem.headline: Turkish troops kill 27 Kurd rebels in southeast.

text.p: Turkish armed forces killed 27 Kurdish rebels in separate clashes in the east of the country, security officials said on Friday.
The emergency rule governor's office said in a statement the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) guerrillas were killed in fighting in the provinces of Van, Bingol, Sirnak and Tunceli.
It did not say when the clashes took place.
A force of more than 10,000 Turkish troops has been involved in a three-week-old incursion against the PKK in northern Iraq, from where the rebels launch raids into southeast Turkey.
More than 24,000 people have died in 13 years of conflict between the security forces and the rebels who seek self-rule in the southeast.
